title: Matrix Multiplication
narrative:
The tensor API exposes a useful method for Matrix Multiplication.
    This specification not only demonstrates how to use this method
    but also shows how matrix multiplication work 
    for tensors with both row and column major layouts.
    (typically, column major is faster)

features.id: The simple CPU matrix multiplication implementation works as expected.

extraInfo:
Matrix multiplication is possible between matrices of various dimensions,
            data types as well as data layouts!

blocks.text: We instantiate 2 matrices based on the data from the data table at the end of this method.
code: Tsr<?> a = Tsr.of(type, [M,K] as int[], A)
Tsr<?> b = Tsr.of(type, [K,N] as int[], B)

blocks.text: We create the data layout type based on the provided string...
After that we convert both matrices to the layout!
This should of cause make report that they indeed have this new layout.
We now perform the matrix multiplication with the 2 matrix tensors...
The result will have the expected (M x N) shape.
It should have the expected value array.
